snippet.textDisplay: If this virus had originated in Australia and involved primarily white people , no one would be bringing up racism . This virus is a crossover to humans from animals that are in close proximity to large populations of humans . This is a high risk cultural practice that endangers public health ; in this case potentially on a global scale . Condemning these practices apparently flies in the face of lefty cultural relativism that dictates that all cultures must be perceived as equal no matter how morally abhorrent or potentially dangerous to public health their practices may be . The extention of cultural relativism into accusations of racism is the favorite tactic of the left to demonize any criticism of their incoherent ideology . Not all cultural practices are safe for public health , such as trading in exotic animals that are not being monitored for potential pathogens , The only reason the Chinese populations in the west are under scrutiny regarding the Corona virus is because there are large numbers of Chinese expats that visit mainland China on a regular basis , this coupled with the fact that the mode of transmission of this virus is still not known for asymptomatic subjects . The Chinese government has not helped matters by its consistent pattern of concealing information regarding this outbreak .
snippet.textOriginal: If this virus had originated in Australia and involved primarily white people , no one would be bringing up racism . This virus is a crossover to humans from animals that are in close proximity to large populations of humans . Condemning these practices apparently flies in the face of lefty cultural relativism that dictates that all cultures must be perceived as equal no matter how morally abhorrent or potentially dangerous to public health their practices may be . The extention of cultural relativism into accusations of racism is the favorite tactic of the left to demonize any criticism of their incoherent ideology . The Chinese government has not helped matters by its consistent pattern of concealing information regarding this outbreak .

snippet.textDisplay:
You lose credibility by mentioning the flu in an attempt to lull people into a false sense of security. This is not the flu, and comparing the number of fatalities between the two is either incredibly naive or purposefully meant to misinform. Let's just do an overview of the reasons this overused trope is false and dangerous, and at this point it's so aggravating to hear everyone repeating it that it seems blatantly immoral for anyone informed to continue to recycle it:


Now we're using the figures released by one of the least transparent regimes in the world, and this is what they tell us:


The flu has a 0.1% chance of resulting in complications and requiring hospitalization under IC. The number for patients with nCoV is 20%, and among them the mortality rate of patients with SRDS, which is what happens when you have complications with nCoV, is anywhere from 35 to 15% in developed countries with proper care.


The comparison between the flu and nCoV is not valid. For it to be you would have to infect the same number of people with nCoV as the number of people who suffer from the flu anually, and then you would see that the fatalities of nCoV are much greater. This is not statistical science, it's common sense.


A person with the flu will on average infect 1.4 -1.7 people while they're either sick or shedding the virus. This number is called the R0. The R0 of nCoV is calculated by prominent Chinese scientists with the latest data available to be 4.08, which would make this an unprecedented pandemic. By comparison the spanish flu of 1918 was anywhere from 1.2 - 3.0. This is why the Chinese authorities have quarantined over 50 million people, in an attempt to lower this massive number to a manageable level.


nCoV is more infectious and more lethal than the flu, and has spread more than SARS had at this point in its respective outbreak. We're dealing with a virus that continues to shed before and after showing symptoms for a period of approximately (and this number is constantly fluctuating) 15 days. The flu has got nothing on these numbers, and everyone should take precaution. Stop misinforming people in an otherwise educational entry level video explaining a little bit about how the immune system works.
snippet.textOriginal:
You lose credibility by mentioning the flu in an attempt to lull people into a false sense of security. This is not the flu, and comparing the number of fatalities between the two is either incredibly naive or purposefully meant to misinform. Let's just do an overview of the reasons this overused trope is false and dangerous, and at this point it's so aggravating to hear everyone repeating it that it seems blatantly immoral for anyone informed to continue to recycle it:


Now we're using the figures released by one of the least transparent regimes in the world, and this is what they tell us:


*The flu has a 0.1% chance of resulting in complications and requiring hospitalization under IC. The number for patients with nCoV is 20%, and among them the mortality rate of patients with SRDS, which is what happens when you have complications with nCoV, is anywhere from 35 to 15% in developed countries with proper care.*


*The comparison between the flu and nCoV is not valid.* For it to be you would have to infect the same number of people with nCoV as the number of people who suffer from the flu anually, and then you would see that the fatalities of nCoV are much greater. This is not statistical science, it's common sense.


*A person with the flu will on average infect 1.4 -1.7 people while they're either sick or shedding the virus. This number is called the R0. The R0 of nCoV is calculated by prominent Chinese scientists with the latest data available to be 4.08, which would make this an unprecedented pandemic. By comparison the spanish flu of 1918 was anywhere from 1.2 - 3.0.* This is why the Chinese authorities have quarantined over 50 million people, in an attempt to lower this massive number to a manageable level.


nCoV is more infectious and more lethal than the flu, and has spread more than SARS had at this point in its respective outbreak. We're dealing with a virus that continues to shed before and after showing symptoms for a period of approximately (and this number is constantly fluctuating) 15 days. The flu has got nothing on these numbers, and everyone should take precaution. Stop misinforming people in an otherwise educational entry level video explaining a little bit about how the immune system works.

snippet.textDisplay:
Hi, coronavirus is not an excuse for racism and xenophobia thank you.

"It i because they eat bats". Use your brain dear, bat is considered an animal. Humans innecesarily eat animals. Eating animals causes unnumerous damages to our bodies and we are not conscious of it at all.
"You are idiot or what, a BAT is not for human consumption". This phrase is actually especicism.

Empathy, please, empathy. We are all different. Different country, culture, language. Different mindset and points of view. What you consider bad, they might consider it good and viceversa. It hurts me so much seeing everyday those kind of comments so brainless. We all did wrong. So lets start taking care of what we are doing by ourself.

No faith.
snippet.textOriginal:
Hi, coronavirus is not an excuse for racism and xenophobia thank you.

"It i because they eat bats". Use your brain dear, bat is considered an animal. Humans innecesarily eat animals. Eating animals causes unnumerous damages to our bodies and we are not conscious of it at all.
 "You are idiot or what, a BAT is not for human consumption". This phrase is actually especicism. 

Empathy, please, empathy. We are all different. Different country, culture, language. Different mindset and points of view. What you consider bad, they might consider it good and viceversa. It hurts me so much seeing everyday those kind of comments so brainless. We all did wrong. So lets start taking care of what we are doing by ourself. 

No faith.

snippet.textDisplay: Living in California where it's probably the most diverse state in the US, I thought I'd encounter racism on my daily commute to the train. I would wear a mask, even though I am perfectly healthy, and mostly wear it caution myself against anyone else who may be sick. So far, I haven't encountered any racist remarks or anything although I did get a few odd looks here and there and some people would rather stand than sit next to me.
snippet.textOriginal: Living in California where it's probably the most diverse state in the US, I thought I'd encounter racism on my daily commute to the train. I would wear a mask, even though I am perfectly healthy, and mostly wear it caution myself against anyone else who may be sick. So far, I haven't encountered any racist remarks or anything although I did get a few odd looks here and there and some people would rather stand than sit next to me.

snippet.textDisplay: "Western meat consumption caused mad cow disease" false poor agriculture practices - the feedinf of dead cow parts to live cows, caused mad cows disease, not the farming & consumption of cows themselves. Once this was realised, it was recitified & never done again. China has repratedly had illness & infection directly because of their willfull unsanitary & inhumane actions, literally this exact same thing happened in 2003, and they make no effort to change, but they're free from criticism because "culture"
snippet.textOriginal: "Western meat consumption caused mad cow disease" *false* poor agriculture practices - the feedinf of dead cow parts to live cows, caused mad cows disease, not the farming & consumption of cows themselves. Once this was realised, it was recitified & never done again.
